ud5.3:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
ud5.3:1.3: At that time in Rājagaha there was a leper called Suppabuddha.
ud5.3:1.4: He was poor, destitute, and pitiful.
ud5.3:1.5: Now, at that time the Buddha was teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly.
ud5.3:2.1: Suppabuddha saw the crowd seated off in the distance
ud5.3:2.3: “Surely some variety of foods will be distributed there.
ud5.3:2.4: Why don’t I approach the crowd?
ud5.3:2.5: Hopefully I’ll get something to eat.”
ud5.3:3.2: where he saw the Buddha teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly.
ud5.3:3.3: When he saw this he thought,
ud5.3:3.5: The ascetic Gotama is teaching Dhamma in an assembly.
ud5.3:3.6: Why don’t I also listen to the teaching?”
ud5.3:3.7: Right there he sat down to one side, thinking,
ud5.3:3.8: “I also will listen to the teaching.”
ud5.3:4.1: Then the Buddha focused on comprehending the minds of everyone in the Saṅgha, thinking, “Who here is capable of understanding the teaching?”
ud5.3:4.2: He saw Suppabuddha sitting in the assembly,
ud5.3:4.4: “He is capable of understanding the teaching.”
ud5.3:4.5: He gave a step by step talk especially for Suppabuddha
ud5.3:4.6: on giving, ethical conduct, and heaven.
ud5.3:4.7: He explained the drawbacks of sensual pleasures, so sordid and corrupt, and the benefit of renunciation.
ud5.3:4.9: When the Buddha knew that Suppabuddha’s mind was ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas:
ud5.3:4.10: suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.
ud5.3:4.11: Just as a clean cloth rid of stains would properly absorb dye,
ud5.3:4.12: in that very seat the stainless, immaculate vision of the Dhamma in Suppabuddha:
ud5.3:4.13: “Everything that has a beginning has an end.”
ud5.3:5.1: Then Suppabuddha saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the Dhamma. He went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teacher’s instructions. He rose from his seat and went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said:
